clinical_study.brief_title: Transcranial Alternating Current Stimulation (tACS) in Patients With Ataxia
clinical_study.official_title: Interventional Cross-over Study to Evaluate the Efficacy on Motor and Cognitive Performance of Transcranial Alternating Current Stimulation (tACS) in Patients With Neurodegenerative Ataxia

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Socio Sanitaria Territoriale degli Spedali Civili di Brescia

clinical_study.source: Azienda Socio Sanitaria Territoriale degli Spedali Civili di Brescia

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to evaluate the effects on motor and cognitive performance of transcranial alternating current stimulation (tACS) compared to transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) and placebo stimulation (sham) in patients with neurodegenerative ataxia to identify a possible rehabilitation protocol.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the International Cooperative Ataxia Rating Scale (ICARS) Score From Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (immediately before the intervention) - Immediately after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: International Cooperative Ataxia Rating Scale (ICARS): semi-quantitative 100-point scale, yielding a total score of 0 (no ataxia) to 100 (most severe ataxia).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in the Scale for the Assessment and Rating of Ataxia (SARA) Score From Baseline
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (immediately before the intervention) - Immediately after the intervention
primary_outcome.description: Scale for the Assessment and Rating of Ataxia (SARA): 8-item performance based scale, yielding a total score of 0 (no ataxia) to 40 (most severe ataxia).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Cerebellar Brain Inhibition (CBI) Measurements From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (immediately before the intervention) - Immediately after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Cerebellar brain inhibition (CBI) is expressed as motor evoked potential amplitude (average of 10 recordings). Lower values reflect higher inhibition and thus reduced impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Timed Up and Go Test Duration From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (immediately before the intervention) - Immediately after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Time (in seconds) that a person takes to rise from a chair, walk three meters, turn around 180 degrees, walk back to the chair, and sit down while turning 180 degrees, assessed with gait sensors.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Walking Cadence From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (immediately before the intervention) - Immediately after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Average Left and Right Steps/Minute during a 60 seconds walk, assessed with gait sensors.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (immediately before the intervention) - Immediately after the intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Velocity (Number of Degrees/sec) in making a 360° turn, assessed with gait sensors

arm_group.description: Single session of anodal tDCS at 2 mA over the cerebellar hemispheres
Single session of gamma tACS (50 Hz) at 3 mA over the cerebellar hemispheres
Single session of sham tDCS over the cerebellar hemispheres

intervention.intervention_name: Transcranial stimulation over the cerebellar hemispheres
intervention.description: Single session of Transcranial stimulation over the cerebellar hemispheres

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a cerebellar syndrome and quantifiable cerebellar atrophy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe head trauma in the past
- History of seizures
- History of ischemic stroke or hemorrhage
- Pacemaker
- Metal implants in the head/neck region
- Severe comorbidity
- Intake of illegal drugs
- Pregnancy
